name: The Market (Prototype)
description:
PICO-8 is a Fantasy Console used for making ``tiny`` games.
It runs on a resolution of 128x128 pixels.
If you`d like to learn more about PICO-8, check out this link:
https://www.lexaloffle.com/pico-8.php

Game Details:

At the moment The Market Prototype is very bare-bones. I have the basic infrastructure in place, and it is technically playable, though. There are two product shares available to buy/sell; Cola and Coffee. The prices fluctuate up and down, within a certain margin, and it is your job to decide the best time to buy or sell.

Currently there is no real use for the in-game money, aside from buying stocks. But, I have plans to change that in the future, such as some kind of upgrades you'd spend your money on.

Note:
I only have access to a Windows PC, so the Linux version is untested.
Feedback as to whether it works, or if it works differently, is appreciated.

Game Controls:
Up and Down Arrow Keys - Navigate Shares
Left and Right Arrow Keys - Buy or Sell Shares
Z Key - Save Game
X Key - Load Game

Current Features (v0.2):
-2 Products
-Fluctuating Share Price
-Ability to Save and Load

Potential or Planned Features:
More Products
Upgrades to Purchase
Multiple Game Screens and Menu`s (possibly a graph screen)
More, More, More... (will take suggestions)
